snippet: The assignment of a single unarmed South Korean police bodyguard to accompany Ambassador Mark W. Lippert on his movements in the country added to questions about security when he was attacked.
abstract: United States officials say single unarmed South Korean police bodyguard was provided to protect Mark W Lippert, American ambassador to South Korea who was attacked in Seoul by Kim Ki-jong; statement adds to questions about whether security provided was too lax.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun reported from Seoul, and Michael R. Gordon from London.

lead_paragraph: The assignment of a single unarmed South Korean police bodyguard to accompany Ambassador Mark W. Lippert on his movements in the country added to questions about security when he was attacked.

headline.main: U.S. Relied on Unarmed South Korean Officer to Protect Envoy
headline.print_headline: U.S. Used Unarmed Guard for South Korea Envoy
